METHOD_1_API_TO_LANDSCAPES.approach: Google Maps API → UE5 Terrain Generation
components: Google Maps Elevation API for height data
Google Earth Engine for satellite imagery
UE5 Landscape system for terrain generation
Procedural building generation from footprint data
advantages: Native UE5 performance - no web overhead
Offline capability once data is cached
disadvantages: Complex initial setup and data processing
Google Maps API costs for elevation/imagery

METHOD_2_WEB_INTEGRATION.approach: Embedded Google Maps JavaScript in UE5 UI
advantages: Rapid deployment - Google handles all mapping
Full Google Maps feature set available

components: Enhanced storm_package.py with Maps API integration
advantages: Optimal for NODE OUT cognitive architecture

BATTLEFIELD_ANALYSIS.primary_objective: Storm visualization dominance with mapping accuracy
secondary_objectives: Integration with existing NODE OUT systems
enemy_weaknesses: No real-time 3D storm visualization in market

REASONING: SPEED TO MARKET: 1-2 weeks vs 4-6 weeks = critical advantage
PROOF OF CONCEPT: Validates concept before heavy investment
ITERATION CAPABILITY: Easy to modify and enhance
IMMEDIATE IMPACT: Can demo to clients within weeks
STRATEGIC_DEPLOYMENT_SEQUENCE: Phase 1: Deploy Method 2 for immediate capability
Phase 3: Evaluate Method 1 for premium offerings
Phase 4: Scale successful approach across markets

COMPETITIVE_INTELLIGENCE.market_gap: No integrated storm + mapping + contractor dispatch
